channel.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
channel.description:
Well I'm wondering which one should I take the time and learn? Mostly for game developing, and similar stuff. As well would it be that hard to learn the language?
Thanks in advance for answering my question :)

item.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
item.dc:creator: @Shilo_Village Shilo Village
item.description:
@Shilo_Village wrote:

[quote=“pure2ownage, post:10, topic:349550”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=445923.msg3274126#msg3274126 date=1279425740]

If runescape type then: C++
If gay flashy things then: Java

Uh, runescape is written in Java, so that is obviously wrong.

I would start with Java, it will teach you good habits that will carry over into C++ well. Once you learn one, the other should be very easy.
[/quote] Ain’t only the client in Java and the server in “RuneScript”, although it is a decendant of C++ and Java[/quote]You realize that any type of “script” is interpreted by another language.

Example: In the “script” you may call sM(“Noob”) while the interpreting file will declare a method that corresponds to that of sM, so most likely it would call something like player.getFrames().sendMessage(“Noob”);

Read full topic
item.source: Java or C++ for game developing?

flash

ActionScript is terrible.
[/quote]l2recognize sarcasm

How do you expect sarcasm to be picked up in a single word, in text?[/quote]Because anyone that knew anything about the language would know I was kidding, just as if I said:

VB

item.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
item.dc:creator: @k_a_h_leader Aeolian
item.description:
@k_a_h_leader wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:13, topic:349550”][quote author=pure2ownage link=topic=445923.msg3274580#msg3274580 date=1279455099]

If runescape type then: C++
If gay flashy things then: Java

Uh, runescape is written in Java, so that is obviously wrong.

I would start with Java, it will teach you good habits that will carry over into C++ well. Once you learn one, the other should be very easy.
[/quote] Ain’t only the client in Java and the server in “RuneScript”, although it is a decendant of C++ and Java

‘Runescript’ is not a programming language. And there is no way to tell what the server is written in, though it’s probably Java.[/quote]

RuneScript is simply a scripting language made by Jagex to make content development easier.

Though the very core of the RuneScape server is written in purely Java, as confirmed by themselves.

RuneScape Wiki

RuneScript

RuneScript is a scripting language that Jagex uses to create content for RuneScape. The game engine is not written in RuneScript, but instead Java. RuneScript was developed by Jagex Ltd. to allow their other staff that do not know Java to add and...

Read full topic
item.source: Java or C++ for game developing?

item.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

[quote=“Adam, post:23, topic:349550”]The difficult aspect of C++ for most people are pointers and the fact that C++ does not have automatic garbage collection like Java does. C++ requires the user to know what they’re doing, while Java doesn’t necessarily.[/quote]c++ isnt nearly as low level as c is regarding memory handling, especially when one properly takes advantage of class destructors

Read full topic
item.source: Java or C++ for game developing?

-JavaScript

-JavaApplets

But I’m learning JavaScript and C++ at the moment.

-Nameme123[/quote]

What? Your post wasn’t very relevant to the topic.

can you stop please.
[/quote]

I have only learned basics, and basics were really easy to understand/learn. Sorry, I must of taken a huge assumption.[/quote]I can see where you’re coming from, as I’m doing the same thing ;). However, it’s incredibly broad as you move on. C++ is far from overcoming with the experience you or I have as of right now.

item.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Adam Adam
item.description:
@Mod_Adam wrote:

The difficult aspect of C++ for most people are pointers and the fact that C++ does not have automatic garbage collection like Java does. C++ requires the user to know what they’re doing, while Java doesn’t necessarily.

Read full topic
item.source: Java or C++ for game developing?

item.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:21, topic:349550"][quote author=noobs are ftw link=topic=445923.msg3276651#msg3276651 date=1279573421]
c#
[/quote]
no.

c++ but it would be harder then java

Xbox 360 games are made out of C++. And C++ is easier.

can you stop please.[/quote]

What he means to say is, not all of them are written from pure C++. Also, C++ is probably the most difficult. Because it is so compatible there are hundreds of thousands of different ways to approach a scenario. Java was developed more user friendly and is much much easier.

Read full topic

item.title: Java or C++ for game developing?
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:17, topic:349550"][quote author=zuppers link=topic=445923.msg3276305#msg3276305 date=1279558148]

“We write in a scripting language called RuneScript, which our Game Engine team has created specifically for making RuneScape content. The Java-based game engine then reads this RuneScript code and makes it all work. RuneScript is constantly being changed and expanded as we add new features to it to allow it to do new things.”

[/quote]
There it is, there was another one saying it was built on Java SE 6, someone had asked what version of Java the server was run on and if it was EE etc.[/quote]

Emg Blue asks: What Java platform does RuneScape use? Java EE, Java SE? Or are the servers on EE and clients on SE?

Java SE for both client and server.

From: http://forum.runescape.com/l=0/forums.ws?13,14,692,59515385

Read full topic
item.source: Java or C++ for game developing?

If runescape type then: C++
If gay flashy things then: Java

Uh, runescape is written in Java, so that is obviously wrong.

I would start with Java, it will teach you good habits that will carry over into C++ well. Once you learn one, the other should be very easy.
[/quote] Ain’t only the client in Java and the server in “RuneScript”, although it is a decendant of C++ and Java

‘Runescript’ is not a programming language. And there is no way to tell what the server is written in, though it’s probably Java.[/quote]
It’s Java, it was discussed on the RuneScape forum quite some time ago.
If a someone else could find the thread you could see…
